name: Gram Parsons
description: '''Ingram Cecil Connor III''' (November 5, 1946 â€“ September 19, 1973), known professionally as '''Gram Parsons''', was an American singer, songwriter, guitarist, and pianist. He recorded with the [[International Submarine Band]], [[the Byrds]], and [[the Flying Burrito Brothers]], popularizing what he called "Cosmic American Music", a hybrid of [[country music|country]], [[rhythm and blues]], [[soul music|soul]], [[American folk music|folk]], and [[rock music|rock]]. He has been credited with helping to found the [[country rock]] and [[alt-country]] genres and received a ranking of No. 87 on ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine's list of the [[Rolling Stone's 100 Greatest Artists of All Time|100 Greatest Artists of All Time]].{{sfn|Rolling Stone|2005}}
